content.value_statement: Building accessible React user interfaces requires learning shadcn/ui patterns, component installation, and Tailwind customization. This skill provides comprehensive guidance for installing components, implementing forms with validation, and creating accessible UI patterns like dialogs, dropdowns, and tables.

best_practices: Use the shadcn/ui CLI for component installation to ensure proper dependency management
Leverage Radix UI primitives for built-in accessibility features like keyboard navigation and focus management
Customize components by copying them to your project rather than depending on external packages
Use React Hook Form with Zod for type-safe form validation
anti_patterns: Avoid modifying node_modules directly instead of copying components to your project
Do not skip form validation when collecting user input
Avoid hardcoding component styles instead of using Tailwind CSS utilities
Do not ignore accessibility requirements when customizing components

faq.question: What is the difference between shadcn/ui and other component libraries?
faq.answer: shadcn/ui is not a traditional npm package. Instead, you copy components into your project and own the code. This allows full customization while benefiting from well-designed accessible components built on Radix UI primitives.

faq.question: How do I update shadcn/ui components?
faq.answer: Since components are copied to your project, you update them by replacing the component code with the latest version from the shadcn/ui registry or using the CLI to re-add the component.

faq.question: Can I use shadcn/ui with frameworks other than Next.js?
faq.answer: Yes, shadcn/ui works with any React framework including Vite, Create React App, and Remix. You may need to adjust some configuration for your specific framework.

faq.question: How do I add dark mode theming?
faq.answer: Configure dark mode in tailwind.config.js using the 'class' strategy. Define CSS variables for both light and dark modes in your globals.css file, then use the .dark class on the HTML or body element.

faq.question: What validation library works best with shadcn/ui forms?
faq.answer: React Hook Form combined with Zod provides excellent type-safe validation and integrates seamlessly with shadcn/ui form components through the zodResolver.

faq.question: How do I create custom variants of shadcn/ui components?
faq.answer: Use the class-variance-authority (cva) library that shadcn/ui components are built with. Define variant types and apply them using the cn() utility for conditional class merging.
